title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Ninety-seven cats were rescued from a 1200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket, Rhode Island by the RISPCA.
Some rescued cats are pregnant and have colds; they await vet care and behavior assessments before adoption.
The RISPCA seeks donations for supplies and medical expenses via their item wishlist, Venmo, or PayPal.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran, 29, may see more designated hitter reps amid Boston Red Sox's crowded outfield for the 2026 season.
Duran has been mentioned in trade rumors but remains unfazed, focusing on his role with the Red Sox.
Duran aims to improve his performance after a decline in batting stats; he finished eighth in MVP voting in 2024.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jordan Harris aims to increase hockey accessibility through clinics at Warrior Ice Arena with SCORE Boston.
Harris' Huskies collaborates with SCORE Boston to support underserved youth in learning and playing hockey.
Harris, recovering from injury, looks to help Bruins and engage communities through youth hockey programs.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Simmons predicts Jayson Tatum may return March 1 for the Celtics' game against the 76ers.
NBC's primetime Celtics game on March 1 moved from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. for national broadcast.
Tatum recently participated in a 5-on-5 practice with the Maine Celtics amid Achilles injury rehab.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A Massachusetts State Police trooper was seriously injured on I-95 in Salisbury after his SUV was hit by a car.
The trooper was hospitalized and later released to recover at home; he was hit while removing a ladder from the road.
Driver Josue Levi Cuevas Santana, 24, faces charges including negligent operation and using a mobile device while driving.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel recorded her third shutout in the 2026 Olympics, helping Team USA defeat Sweden 5-0 in the semifinals.
Frankel's performance set a record for the most shutouts by a player in a single Olympic women's hockey tournament.
Team USA will face Canada for the gold medal, following five consecutive shutouts with Frankel and Gwyneth Philips in net.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died after falling through ice at First Encounter Beach in Eastham on February 14, police said.
Her husband is missing after both fell through the ice while walking their dog; search efforts continue, officials reported.
Two police officers attempting a rescue also fell through the ice but returned safely; the couple's dog is with family.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox traded Rafael Devers to the Giants in June after a tumultuous period over defensive position disagreements.
Tom Werner expressed disappointment in Devers' reluctance to play first base after a Red Sox injury required it.
Red Sox signed Alex Bregman in 2025, intending for Devers to switch from third base to designated hitter.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox president Sam Kennedy addresses concerns over team investment in winning after losses of Rafael Devers and Alex Bregman.
Devers was traded after disputes over position changes; Bregman signed with Cubs seeking a contract with no-trade clause.
Kennedy defends ownership's commitment, citing the Red Sox's projected $256.1 million payroll, seventh highest in MLB.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured in shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people, including the shooter, were killed during a targeted family dispute at a high school hockey game in Pawtucket.
The Pawtucket shooting left three others critically injured; the shooter was identified as Robert Dorgan, who died from a self-inflicted wound.
Authorities are investigating the shooting, which occurred behind the BVS bench; more than 100 witnesses have been interviewed.
